title: cata-list
description: Useful lists of some of the best info, media, tools, and quotes for those who seek to understand and improve this world.
copyright: Copyright © 2020 Matthew McCutcheon. All rights reserved

articles.title: It's Called Artificial Intelligence — But What Is Intelligence?
articles.description: We've built machines that are capable of incredible feats, yet still they have nothing on a baby.

articles.title: Is the Brain a Useful Model for Artificial Intelligence?
articles.description: Thinking machines think just like us—but only up to a point.

articles.title: Are AI-Powered Killer Robots Inevitable?
articles.description: Military scholars warn of a 'battlefield singularity,' a point at which humans can no longer keep up with the pace of conflict.

articles.title: 'First Ever' Near Real-Time Analysis of Global Carbon Emissions Reveals Coronavirus Impacts
articles.description: Lockdowns around the world are having a measurable effect on global greenhouse gas emissions. A new study out Tuesday found that daily emissions dropped by 17 percent in April 2020 compared to last year's average levels. This is a sizable dip, but the findings offer a sobering reality check: Individ…

articles.title: It's Time to Dismantle Factory Farms and Get Used to Eating Less Meat
articles.description: We should envision a more resilient and sustainable food system, one that doesn't commodify sentient life

articles.title: Carbon Dioxide Emissions Have Dropped 17 Percent During the Pandemic
articles.description: Some regions, like the US and the UK, have seen their outputs fall by a third, due in large part to people driving less.

articles.title: As Machines Get Smarter, How Will We Relate to Them?
articles.description: Millennia of evolution have left us ill prepared to crack open the black box of AI and peer inside.

articles.title: Alarm and Confusion at Fox News as Trump Says He Takes Hydroxychloroquine
articles.description: Fox News viewers were warned not to take medical advice from the president, following Donald Trump's announcement that he takes the drug hydroxychloroquine.

articles.title: Watch a Boston Dynamics Robot Herd Sheep in New Zealand
articles.description: New Zealand-based robotics company Rocos shared a video of Boston Dynamics' Spot herding sheep across grassy pastures.

articles.title: The Arctic Is Unraveling as a Massive Heat Wave Grips the Region
articles.description: It wouldn't be spring in the climate change era without a massive heat wave in the Arctic.

articles.title: US Lockdown Protests May Have Spread Virus Widely, Cellphone Data Suggests
articles.description: Devices associated with protesters travelled up to hundreds of miles after rallies where few precautions were taken

articles.title: CDC Sued Over 'Pattern' of Mishandling Freedom of Information Requests During Pandemic
articles.description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is facing a lawsuit over its alleged mishandling of records requests under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Plaintiffs accuse the agency of 'systematically obstruct[ing]' attempts by the public to acquire details about the government's handl…

articles.title: China's Air Pollution Is Now Worse Than Pre-Coronavirus Levels
articles.description: Last month, China finally ended its coronavirus lockdown. While air quality improved dramatically during The Quiet Time, new data shows it was short-lived. What's more, air pollution is coming back at higher levels than during the same period last year.

articles.title: Cell-Tower Attacks by Idiots Who Claim 5G Spreads COVID-19 Reportedly Hit US
articles.description: US warns carriers to boost security, citing reports of attacks in several states.

articles.title: Federal Government Buys Riot Gear, Increases Security Funding, Citing Coronavirus Pandemic
articles.description: The orders are for disposable cuffs, gas masks, ballistic helmets, riot gloves, and equipment for federal police assigned to Veterans Affairs facilities.

articles.title: 'Stealth Bailout' Shovels Millions of Dollars to Oil Companies
articles.description: As it headed toward bankruptcy, Diamond Offshore Drilling Inc. took advantage of a little-noticed provision in the stimulus bill Congress passed in March to get a $9.7 million tax refund. Then, it asked a bankruptcy judge to authorize the same amount as bonuses to nine executives.

articles.title: U.S. Government Proposed Manipulating CDC Guidelines to Avoid Mask Shortages: Whistleblower
articles.description: The U.S. government proposed manipulating information about whether N95 masks worked to fight the spread of coronavirus in the general public, according to Dr. Richard Bright, a whistleblower who testified publicly for the first time on Thursday. The deception was an effort to avoid shortages and ke…

articles.title: Whistleblower: Wall Street Has Engaged in Widespread Manipulation of Mortgage Funds
articles.description: Securities that contain loans for properties like hotels and office buildings have inflated profits, the whistleblower claims. As the pandemic hammers the economy, that could increase the chances of another mortgage collapse.

articles.title: Senate Votes to Reauthorize FBI Surveillance Powers, With a Few Worthwhile Tweaks
articles.description: In an 80-16 vote on Thursday, the U.S. Senate passed a bill to restore controversial surveillance tools used by the FBI in terrorism and espionage investigations. But the bill has at least one more hurdle to jump thanks to a series of changes implemented yesterday.

articles.title: Struggling Oil Companies Are Taking Advantage of US Coronavirus Aid
articles.description: Recent review finds at least $113m in taxpayer-backed loans meant for small businesses have gone to fossil fuel industry

articles.title: Senate Passes Spying Bill Without Search and Browsing History Protections
articles.description: An amendment protecting search and browsing histories failed in a 59-37 vote.

articles.title: In a First, Renewable Energy Is Poised to Eclipse Coal in U.S.
articles.description: The coronavirus has pushed the coal industry to once-unthinkable lows, and the consequences for climate change are big.

articles.title: Police Shot and Killed a 26-Year-Old EMT in Her Apartment While Looking for Someone Else Entirely
articles.description: Breonna Taylor had no criminal record, and police found no drugs in her home.

articles.title: FBI Accuses China of Attempting to Steal US COVID-19 Research
articles.description: The FBI warns that China-backed hackers are attempting to steal COVID-19 research from organizations in the US.

articles.title: Here's Who Just Voted to Let the FBI Seize Your Online Search History Without a Warrant
articles.description: A bipartisan amendment that would have prohibited law enforcement agencies, such as the FBI, from obtaining the web browsing and internet search histories of Americans without a warrant failed to pass in the U.S. Senate on Wednesday by a single vote.

articles.title: The New Alzheimer's–Air Pollution Link
articles.description: Toxic airborne particles can travel from lungs and nose to the brain, and exposure is linked to memory loss

articles.title: U.S. Warns That Chinese Hackers Are Targeting Virus Research
articles.description: Hackers working for the Chinese government are trying to steal valuable research on coronavirus vaccines and treatments from U.S. health care, pharmaceutical and research organizations, the FBI and the Department of Homeland Security warned Wednesday.

articles.title: Your Boss Is Watching You: Work-From-Home Boom Leads to More Surveillance
articles.description: With more people now working from home, employers are increasingly relying on tracking software to monitor what employees do when they're on the clock.

articles.title: Big Oil's Climate Plans Don't Come Close to Meeting the Paris Agreement
articles.description: Climate action plans are all the rage for polluting companies. Last month, Shell pledged to reach net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. It's just the latest example: Other oil giants have recently made similar pledges as well. These pronouncements use pseudo-inspirational marketing speak, promising to …

articles.title: COVID-19 Resurges in Reopened Countries; Wuhan Sees First Cluster in a Month
articles.description: China ordered all Wuhan residents get tested for COVID-19—that's ~11 million people.

articles.title: Federal Whistleblower Says Boss Pushed Him to Buy Drugs That Hadn't Been Tested in Humans
articles.description: Rick Bright's complaint points to the influence of industry over the Trump administration's coronavirus response.

articles.title: That Fresh Sea Breeze You Breathe May Be Laced With Microplastic
articles.description: Researchers have discovered that the ocean is burping tiny plastic particles, which then blow onto land—and potentially into your lungs.

articles.title: Online Voting Has Worked So Far. That Doesn't Mean It's Safe
articles.description: Proponents of mobile and internet voting point to its uneventful track record. That's not good enough.

articles.title: Large Chunks of a Chinese Rocket Missed New York City by About 15 Minutes
articles.description: China's Long March 5B rocket launched without a second stage.

articles.title: How Much Is a Human Life Actually Worth?
articles.description: As the US economy reopens amid a deadly pandemic, a dire question looms. Let's weigh the risks—and do the math.

articles.title: The Bailout Is Working — for the Rich
articles.description: The economy is in free fall but Wall Street is thriving, and stocks of big private equity firms are soaring dramatically higher. That tells you who investors think is the real beneficiary of the federal government's massive rescue efforts.

articles.title: The Pandemic Is Bringing Back Single-Use Plastics in a Huge Way
articles.description: States are rolling back their plastic bag bans and restaurants are turning to single-use utensils to reopen in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.

articles.title: At Least $72 Million in Coronavirus Bailout Loans Went to Big Oil and Gas Companies
articles.description: At least 16 drillers, fuel transporters, oil technology firms and service providers tapped the Small Business Association's Paycheck Protection Program.

articles.title: With a Distracted Public, the Pentagon Tries to Get Away With Killing Innocent Civilians
articles.description: The Pentagon's annual report to Congress covering civilian casualties appears to be yet another case of woefully underreporting innocent deaths.

articles.title: US Marshals Says Prisoners' Personal Information Taken in Data Breach
articles.description: Current and former prisoners were notified of the breach on May 1.

articles.title: U.S. Unemployment Just Hit Its Highest Level Since the Great Depression
articles.description: The American job market is in full-on meltdown.

articles.title: For Cops Who Kill, Special Supreme Court Protection
articles.description: The U.S. high court's continual refinement of an obscure doctrine called qualified immunity has made it harder to hold police liable for excessive force.

articles.title: An Oil Spill and the Coronavirus Are Creating a Crisis in Ecuador's Amazon
articles.description: Imagine being told to shelter at home due to a global pandemic, only to have your home, drinking water, and food stores destroyed. It would be a nightmare, but that is exactly what happened for indigenous people in the Ecuadorian Amazon after a massive oil spill polluted two major rivers.

articles.title: CDC Guide to Reopening Was Trashed by the Trump Admin. It Just Leaked
articles.description: Trump admin allegedly told CDC its reopening guide would 'never see the light of day.'

articles.title: We Are Tenants on Our Own Devices
articles.description: It's time to assert our sovereignty over our own stuff.

articles.title: Whistleblower Details How HHS Officials Refused to Secure N95 Masks as Pandemic Loomed
articles.description: The report from Richard Bright reveals a new villain in the tragic saga of the administration's mismanagement of the coronavirus crisis: Robert Kadlec.

articles.title: Farmers Are Destroying Mountains of Food. Here's What to Do About It
articles.description: The Covid-19 pandemic has revealed the cracks in a corporate-focused system supported by polices that favor profits at any cost

articles.title: Prisons Will Worsen Coronavirus Crisis in Rural America
articles.description: The prison economy has been a lifeline for rural communities for decades, but that lifeline has transformed into a vector for coronavirus.

articles.title: We've Known How to Make Healthier Buildings for Decades
articles.description: During the pandemic, people are now demanding them.

articles.title: Nearly 20,000 Teens in Georgia Have Received Their Driver's Licenses Without a Road Test
articles.description: Georgia isn't the only state that is waiving road tests. Wisconsin announced this week that it will start doing the same for 16- and 17-year-olds, starting Monday.

articles.title: Here Are the Companies Getting Rich From the Coronavirus Pandemic
articles.description: Scott Disick, of 'Keeping Up With the Kardashians' fame, pushed out a line of T-shirts and hoodies emblazoned with the timely message 'Wash Your Hands.'

articles.title: Mass Incarceration Poses a Uniquely American Risk in the Coronavirus Pandemic
articles.description: The virus has exposed just how deadly prisons and jails are for incarcerated people, and for society at large.

articles.title: U.S. Companies Cut Thousands of Workers While Continuing to Reward Shareholders During Pandemic
articles.description: As the pandemic squeezes big companies, executives are making decisions about who will bear the brunt of the sacrifices, and in at least some cases, workers have been the first to lose, even as shareholders continue to collect.

articles.title: Speaker Pelosi Supports Push for Taxpayer Bailout of Corporate Lobbyists
articles.description: Trade groups have stepped up a campaign for $25 billion and PPP eligibility in the next phase of coronavirus relief.

articles.title: America's Renewable Energy Sources Have Produced More Electricity Than Coal Every Day for 40 Days Straight
articles.description: The transition away from coal for electricity generation in the U.S. accelerated in 2020 due to lower gas prices, warmer weather and the economic conditions resulting from COVID-19, analysis found.

articles.title: An AI Can Simulate an Economy Millions of Times to Create Fairer Tax Policy
articles.description: Deep reinforcement learning has trained AIs to beat humans at complex games like Go and StarCraft. Could it also do a better job at running the economy?

articles.title: U.K. Reports Highest Coronavirus Death Toll in Europe
articles.description: It surpassed Italy.

articles.title: Jared Kushner's Shadow Coronavirus Task Force Used a Spreadsheet Called 'VIP Update' to Procure PPE From Inexperienced Trump Allies Over Legitimate Vendors
articles.description: In theory, the group was supposed to find the most promising leads on protective gear and funnel them to FEMA. Instead, it prioritized Trump allies.

articles.title: US Projects 200,000 New COVID-19 Cases per Day, 3,000 Daily Deaths by June
articles.description: Leaked gov't document predicts rise in deaths as Trump aims to 'open up America.'

articles.title: Three Russian Doctors 'Fall' From Hospital Windows, Raising Questions Amid Coronavirus Pandemic
articles.description: Three frontline health care workers have mysteriously fallen out of hospital windows in Russia over the past two weeks, heightening public attention to the working conditions for doctors and medical professionals amid the coronavirus pandemic.

articles.title: The World Came Together for a Virtual Vaccine Summit. The U.S. Was Conspicuously Absent.
articles.description: International donors are on track to raise $8.2 billion to mass-produce drugs, vaccines and testing kits. The Trump administration says the U.S. remains the world's largest health and humanitarian donor.

articles.title: How Many Jobs Do Robots Really Replace?
articles.description: MIT economist Daron Acemoglu's new research puts a number on the job costs of automation.

articles.title: Hostile States Trying to Steal Coronavirus Research, Says UK Agency
articles.description: Experts say Russia, Iran and China likely to be behind cyber-attacks on universities

articles.title: US Store Guard Killed After Mask Row With Customer
articles.description: A Michigan store guard is shot in the back of the head after confronting a customer who had no mask.

articles.title: China Thinks Backlash to Its Coronavirus Response Could Lead to All-Out War With the U.S.
articles.description: A State Security report warned that anti-China sentiment, led by the U.S., has not been this high since the 1989 Tiananmen Square crackdown.

articles.title: Which States Are Reopening, Which Remain on Lockdown, and Why
articles.description: There's not a national plan to restart US businesses. That's led to inconsistencies among governors' orders, and some confusion among residents.

articles.title: Medical Expert: Federal Jail Intentionally Destroying Medical Records and Hiding Extent of Coronavirus Behind Bars
articles.description: 'Several current practices in MDC actually promote a more rapid spread of COVID-19 inside the facility.'

articles.title: Donald Trump's Four-Step Plan to Reopen the US Economy – and Why It Will Be Lethal
articles.description: The president and his allies are hiding the facts and pretending 'freedom' conquers all. As a result, more Americans will die

articles.title: White House Blocks Fauci From Testifying to Congress on Coronavirus Response
articles.description: Top U.S. health official Anthony Fauci will not testify next week to a congressional committee examining the Trump administration's response to the coronavirus pandemic, the White House said on Friday, calling it 'counterproductive' to have individuals involved in the response testify.

articles.title: The World Is Still Producing More Oil Than It Needs. Why?
articles.description: Today, petroleum producers around the world will start shutting down wells after the Covid-19 pandemic caused demand to plummet. What took them so long?

articles.title: Judge Orders FCC to Hand Over IP Addresses Linked to Fake Net Neutrality Comments
articles.description: A Manhattan federal judge has ruled the Federal Communications Commission must provide two reporters access to server logs that may provide new insight into the allegations of fraud stemming from agency's 2017 net neutrality rollback.

articles.title: Congress Is Investigating Cruise Ship Company Carnival Over COVID-19 Outbreaks
articles.description: Carnival is accused of failing to take action when it knew the risks of the novel coronavirus.

articles.title: China Warns Australia It Could Face Boycotts Over Call for an Independent Inquiry Into Coronavirus
articles.description: China has accused Australia of parroting the United States in its call for an inquiry independent of the WHO to determine the origins of COVID-19.

articles.title: Jobs Collapse Is Deeper Than the Government Says
articles.description: Economists' workforce surveys are more current than the government's. And more terrifying.

articles.title: People With Guns (And No Masks) Swarmed the Michigan State Capitol to Protest the Coronavirus Lockdown
articles.description: Some state legislators, anticipating the possibility of violence, had even come to work that day wearing bulletproof vests.

articles.title: 'Microplastic Hot Spots' Are Tainting Deep-Sea Ecosystems
articles.description: Scientists found 2 million microplastic particles in a square meter of sediment, as currents drag debris into seafloor versions of the Great Pacific Garbage Patch.

articles.title: Pence Threatened to Punish the Reporter Who Proved His Office Ignored the Rule That He Needed a Mask to Visit the Mayo Clinic
articles.description: Steve Herman undermined Pence's wife's claim that the vice president didn't know he was supposed to wear a mask during the much-criticized visit.

articles.title: It Could Take Decades for the Ocean Floor to Recover From Deep Sea Mining
articles.description: A new study has found that the impacts of deep sea mining are still felt a quarter of a century later.

articles.title: Stocks Are Recovering While the Economy Collapses. That Makes More Sense Than You'd Think.
articles.description: While the economy is contracting, the market is soaring. If you look closely at what's up and down, it actually makes sense--for now.

articles.title: Google Play Has Been Spreading Advanced Android Malware for Years
articles.description: Advanced hacker group seeded market with at least 8 apps likely since 2016.

articles.title: The Pandemic Is Accelerating Coal's Demise
articles.description: Electricity in Europe, India, China, and parts of the U.S. is less and less reliant on coal.

articles.title: Inside the Race to Build the Best Quantum Computer on Earth
articles.description: Google's most advanced computer isn't at the company's headquarters in Mountain View, California, nor anywhere in the febrile sprawl of Silicon Valley. It's a few hours' drive south in Santa Barbara, in a flat, soulless office park inhabited mostly by technology firms you've never heard of. An open-…
